DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Post-Operative Elevated Platelet Result Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether there was an elevated result of a medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood following a surgical procedure for platelets, irregular, disc-shaped fragments of large bone marrow cells called megakaryocytes in the blood that assists in blood clotting.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Post-Operative Elevated Platelet Result
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the elevated result of a medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood following a surgical procedure for platelets, irregular, disc-shaped fragments of large bone marrow cells called megakaryocytes in the blood that assists in blood clotting.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: Post-Operative; relating to or occurring during the period immediately following a surgical operation.:Elevated; raised or increased.:platelet. An irregularly shaped disklike cytoplasmic fragment of a megakaryocyte that is shed in the marrow sinus and subsequently found in the peripheral blood where it functions in clotting. A platelet contains granules in the central part (granulomere) and, peripherally, clear protoplasm (hyalomere), but no definite nucleus; is about one-third to one-half the size of an erythrocyte; and contains no hemoglobin. (STED98):Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: Post-Operative; relating to or occurring during the period immediately following a surgical operation.
Raised or increased above normal levels or limits.
An irregular, disc-shaped element in the blood that assists in blood clotting. Platelets are not blood cells, they are fragments of large bone marrow cells called megakaryocytes.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results or effects (does not include CTC Adverse Events) of therapeutic agents or procedures administered to the patient.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
